Articles.Content:
Between 3AM 9th March to 9AM 10th March (GMT) there will be a large NOTAM over the Semnan area. Specifically from the satellite launch site on a long 55* angle across the desert, this is the exact same NOTAM Iran uses on all satellite launch's.

It is theorized this means there will be a satellite launch. If so the satellite will be launched on a regular Safir-1B as usual and could either be the Tadbir or the Sharifsat satellite. Both are scheduled for this year, however it was stated Sharifsat will launched soon in a news article a few weeks ago.

I don't know if anything will happen so lets wait and see...
